intro: Echites grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered echites, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a sprawling, shrub-like habit with hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow with a central disk, and they bloom from late spring to early autumn. Echites grandiflorus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
